body.name: Diono Radian 3RXT Special Edition Slim Fit 3 Across All-in-One Convertible Car Seat, Rear-Facing, Forward-Facing and High-Back Booster, Gray Stone
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery February 21 - 23. Order within 12 hrs 48 mins.
features: Radian 3RX car seat with SuperLatch, cupholder, an adjustable headrest, and head and body support grows with your child for up to 10 years of use with a weight limit of 5 to 120 pounds
Allows for newborn rear-facing, forward-facing harness, and high-back booster mode and designed for rear-facing travel from 5 to 50 pounds which includes an anti-rebound bar to reduce rotation

Mechanically engineered, reinforced steel core made from automotive-grade steel to shield and protect during travel with the famous Radian slim-fit design for a 3-across option to not compromise a child's comfort or safety
Features a 1 hand easy-adjust 12-position headrest to create a safe and comfortable fit for your kids and an easy remove and machine washable cover
Rear-facing from 5 pounds up to 50 pounds for longer, forward-facing with a 5-point harness up to 65 pounds and high back booster mode of up to 120 pounds
body.description: Provide yourself with the assurance that your kiddos will be safe during car travel, and outfit your vehicle with the Diono Radian 3RXT Special Edition Slim Fit 3 Across All-In-One Convertible Car Seat, where safety meets style, and versatility meets peace of mind. This ultimate car seat will grow with your baby so that you only need to rely on 1 safety seat for up to 10 years of your child's life. Allowing for newborn rear-facing, forward-facing harnesses, and high-back booster mode, your children are safe for years to come. Designed for rear-facing travel for 5 to 50 pounds, you can keep your child safe while the steel bar reduces rebound rotation for extended rear-facing trips. Safety starts within. This convertible car seat is mechanically engineered, reinforced steel core made from high-strength automotive-grade steel that will shield and protect during travel. Built with the famous Radian slim-fit design for a 3-cross option to not compromise child or passenger safety and comfort. Stay fresh with easy removal and machine-washable covers. Featuring a 1 hand, easy-adjust 12-position headrest, you can secure your child in style and safety with the Radian 3RXT Special Edition Slim Fit 3 Across All-In-One Convertible Car Seat from Diono because your child deserves nothing but the best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We’ve had a handful of car seats from various companies and this is hands down my favorite. We replaced all of our car seats out to these we love them that much! They’re super compact and the straps tighten and loosen with ease. Even if you don’t need to fit 3 seats across these are still the perfect seat to ensure you maximize the space within your vehicle!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Unless you are flying a lot, and want to get a workout hauling them around, don't bother.
reviews.reviewText: I've had these seats for about 4 years. I have 2 with twins. I am reviewing it in the outboard position of a car since I cannot put just one in. Oh and I really don't think you can get 3 across in a smaller sedan. That's wishful thinking since there are not 3 sets of latch anchors in a car.Rear facing - car:Just like most rear facing seats, you won't have any legroom with one of these behind you. They were even quite large in my van. The base used for rear facing mode is not the greatest and adjustments are not really possible. It also really digs into the seat of the car. Not recommended. I didn't bother using it in this mode. My kids had outgrown their infant carriers, so front facing they went with these right away.Front facing harness - car:Not bad. The LATCH anchors worked as needed, but routing them can be a major pain in the butt since they fall through from one side to the other in a large opening. You will need to clean these, and you will probably take them out to do so, therefore some patience is needed. The harness itself functions okay. On several occasions the pull cord got stuck or was hard to pull. Competitors' seats are better here.Front facing harness - plane:Don't bother unless it's a short flight and the two of you have just 1 kid. My wife and I were coming back to ORD from an international flight of 9 hours. Having 2 tired kids, being tired ourselves, and then having to walk down the infamous corridors of ORD's terminal 5 was a dumpster fire. These seats are way to HEAVY for that. First, folding them up is less than intuitive when you're in a hurry, and then there is no good way to carry them. That was the first and last time I used them this way. The folding mechanism is completely unnecessary in a car, so there's really no point to it and it just adds complexity.Front facing booster - car:Not good here either. The shoulder belt routing is poor. The seat belt is very difficult for my kids to pull through. Also there isn't a good place to stow away the harnesses and latch belts. My Gracos are next level in that aspect. Since I have no plan to have any more kids, and not returning to harness mode, I just cut these all off.Cleaning:Again, not great. The covers should really be machine washable, but doing so is almost guaranteed to tear apart the mesh and felt-like fabric that is on the non-user-facing side.Summary:Would I buy these again? No. With my older kids I had a different brand. They were much more user friendly. I another car I have a pair of Graco seats - much better in every way. Well I guess they don't fit on a plane.
